Most Illustrious Sir Cerro Largo, October 3, 1842

Dear friend. Moved by the friendship that you have kindly shown me and which I appreciate to the degree it deserves, and also desirous of serving a friend, I address you, troubling your attention, so that you may kindly instruct me on the points referred to in the attached, with the earliest convenience.

On this occasion, I remain, as always, your true friend, wishing to have the satisfaction that you occupy the usefulness of your assured servant who kisses your hands. Manuel de Aleman

Postscript

Most illustrious citizen Don Domingo José de Almeida — Bagé.

Answered on October 22, 1842.

This was annexed to the letter from Manuel de la Hoz of October 2, 1842.
